means: object under test 被测试目标
on us transaction 会员内部交易

sentence.Network_en: Barry had his nose put out of joint by Lucy's aloof sophistication.
sentence.Network_cn: 露西的冷淡与世故使得巴里十分不快。

sentence.Network_en: He did not like to be caught out on details.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不喜欢在细节上被人抓住把柄。

sentence.Network_en: Don't worry. We'll have you out of here double-quick.
sentence.Network_cn: 别担心，我们会很快把你从这儿弄出去的。

lj.lj_ly: you were &B{at outs with} my uncle Ned.
lj.lj_ls: 你与我的奈德叔叔不和。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Cricket)(of a side or batsman) having begun an innings and not been dismissed
(of a person, especially after an illness) engaging in normal activity
jx.jx_cn_mean: （人，尤指生病后的人）能正常走动的

lj.lj_ly: he was out for a good time.

jx.jx_en_mean: moving or situated away from (a place, typically one that is enclosed or hidden)

lj.lj_ly: still not a word out of Pearsall.
lj.lj_ls: 皮尔塞耳仍然什么也不说。

jx.jx_en_mean: using (a particular thing) as raw material

lj.lj_ly: a bench fashioned out of a fallen tree trunk.
lj.lj_ls: 用倒伏的树干做的长凳。

lj.lj_ly: they had run out of cash.

phrase.cizu_name: out of it informal 非正式

jx.jx_cn_mean: 局外的；被拒的，未被邀请的

lj.lj_ly: I hate feeling out of it.
lj.lj_ls: 我不喜欢感到是局外人。

jx.jx_en_mean: unaware of what is happening as a result of being uninformed

jx.jx_cn_mean: 决心做某事，力图做某事
无礼的：不友好的；持不同意见的

means.word_mean: 显现出来,明显地,公开地
在野党,遗弃物,被抛弃的人

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English ūt (adverb), ūtian (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch uit and German aus

encyclopedia.content: out，英文单词，作为形容词时表示外面的，下台的，出局的。另有JSP中的隐藏对象out，网络用语“你out了”，表示“你落伍了”。

usage_note.note: Out is often used with verbs of movement, such as ‘walk’ and ‘pull’, and also in phrasal verbs such as ‘give out’ and ‘run out’.
usage_note.translation: out 常与walk, pull等动作动词连用，亦用于 give out, run out 等短语动词中。

entry.def: When something is in a particular place and you take it out, you remove it from that place.

example.ex: Carefully pull out the centre pages...
example.tran: 小心翼翼地抽出中间的几页。

example.ex: He took out his notebook and flipped the pages...
example.tran: 他掏出笔记本，飞快地翻着。

entry.def: You can use out to indicate that you are talking about the situation outside, rather than inside buildings.

example.ex: It's hot out — very hot, very humid.
example.tran: 外面很热——非常炎热而且非常潮湿。

entry.def: If you are out, you are not at home or not at your usual place of work.

example.ex: I tried to get in touch with you yesterday evening, but I think you were out...
example.tran: 我昨晚想要和你联系，但好像你不在家里。

example.ex: She had to go out.
example.tran: 她得出趟门。

entry.def: If you say that someone is out in a particular place, you mean that they are in a different place, usually one far away.

example.ex: The police tell me they've finished their investigations out there...
example.tran: 警方告诉我他们已完成了在那儿的调查工作。

example.ex: Rosie's husband was now out East.
example.tran: 罗茜的丈夫现在远在东部。

entry.def: When the sea or tide goes out, the sea moves away from the shore.

example.ex: The tide was out and they walked among the rock pools.
example.tran: 潮水已经退去，他们走过岩石区的潮水潭。

entry.tran: 缺少，不足，损失（某一数量的钱）
entry.def: If you are out a particular amount of money, you have that amount less than you should or than you did.

example.ex: Me and my friends are out ten thousand dollars, with nothing to show for it!
example.tran: 我和朋友亏了1万美金，还一无所得！

entry.def: If a light or fire is out or goes out, it is no longer shining or burning.

example.ex: All the lights were out in the house...
example.tran: 屋里的灯全都灭了。

example.ex: Several of the lights went out, one after another.
example.tran: 其中几盏灯一个接一个地熄灭了。

entry.def: If flowers are out, their petals have opened.

example.ex: Well, the daffodils are out in the gardens and they're always a beautiful show.
example.tran: 哎呀，花园里的黄水仙开了，它们永远都是一道亮丽的风景。

entry.def: If something such as a book or CD is out, it is available for people to buy.

example.ex: ...cover versions of 40 British Number Ones — out now.
example.tran: 40首英国头榜歌曲的翻唱版现在上市

entry.def: If workers are out, they are on strike.

example.ex: We've been out for two and a half months and we're not going back until we get what we're asking for.
example.tran: 我们已经罢工两个半月了，除非要求得到满足，否则我们不会复工。

entry.def: In a game or sport, if someone is out, they can no longer take part either because they are unable to or because they have been defeated.
In baseball, a player is out if they do not reach a base safely. When three players in a team are out in an inning, then the team is out.

entry.tran: （提议或建议）不能接受的，不值得考虑的
entry.def: If you say that a proposal or suggestion is out, you mean that it is unacceptable.

example.ex: That's right out, I'm afraid.
example.tran: 那恐怕根本行不通。

entry.tran: 不时髦的；不流行的；过时的
entry.def: If you say that a particular thing is out, you mean that it is no longer fashionable at the present time.

example.ex: Romance is making a comeback. Reality is out.
example.tran: 浪漫主义正重新流行起来，而现实主义过时了。

entry.tran: （计算或测量）不准确的，错误的
entry.def: If you say that a calculation or measurement is out, you mean that it is incorrect.

example.ex: When the two ends of the tunnel met in the middle they were only a few inches out.
example.tran: 隧道两端在中间相接时，仅有几英寸的误差。

entry.def: If someone is out to do something, they intend to do it.

example.ex: Most companies these days are just out to make a quick profit.
example.tran: 如今，大多数公司只想能迅速获利。

entry.tran: 公开揭露（公众人物、名人等）的同性恋身份
entry.def: If a group of people out a public figure or famous person, they reveal that person's homosexuality against their wishes.

example.ex: The New York gay action group 'Queer Nation' recently outed an American Congressman.
example.tran: 纽约的同性恋行动组织“酷儿国度”最近揭露一位美国国会议员为同性恋。

usage_note.note: Out of is used with verbs of movement, such as ‘walk’ and ‘pull’, and also in phrasal verbs such as ‘do out of’ and ‘grow out of’. In American English and informal British English, out is often used instead of out of.
usage_note.translation: out of 与 walk, pull 等动作动词连用，亦用于 do out of , grow out of 等短语动词中。在美国英语和非正式的英国英语中，out 常用于代替 out of。

entry.def: If you go out of a place, you leave it.

example.ex: She let him out of the house.
example.tran: 她让他出了屋子。

entry.def: If you take something out of the container or place where it has been, you remove it so that it is no longer there.

example.ex: I always took my key out of my bag and put it in my pocket.
example.tran: 我总是将钥匙从包里取出来放进口袋。

entry.def: If you look or shout out of a window, you look or shout away from the room where you are towards the outside.

example.ex: He went on staring out of the window...
example.tran: 他继续凝视着窗外。

example.ex: He looked out the window at the car on the street below.
example.tran: 他望着窗下街头的那辆汽车。

entry.tran: 避开，未暴露于（太阳、雨或风）
entry.def: If you are out of the sun, the rain, or the wind, you are sheltered from it.

example.ex: People can keep out of the sun to avoid skin cancer.
example.tran: 人们可以通过避免阳光照射来预防皮肤癌。

entry.tran: 摆脱，脱离（尤指令人不快的事）
entry.def: If someone or something gets out of a situation, especially an unpleasant one, they are then no longer in it. If they keep out of it, they do not start being in it.

example.ex: In the past army troops have relied heavily on air support to get them out of trouble...
example.tran: 过去，陆军部队在很大程度上依赖空中支援来摆脱困境。

example.ex: The economy is starting to climb out of recession...
example.tran: 经济开始走出衰退。

entry.def: You can use out of to say that someone leaves an institution.

example.ex: You come out of university and find there are no jobs available...
example.tran: 从大学毕业后却找不到工作。

example.ex: Doctors should be able to decide who they can safely let out of hospital early.
example.tran: 医生应该有权决定谁可以安全地提早出院。

entry.def: If you are out of range of something, you are beyond the limits of that range.

example.ex: Shaun was in the bedroom, out of earshot, watching television...
example.tran: 肖恩在卧室里看电视，听不见。

example.ex: He turned to look back, but by then she was out of sight.
example.tran: 他转头看去，但那时她已经不见了。

entry.def: You use out of to say what feeling or reason causes someone to do something. For example, if you do something out of pity, you do it because you pity someone.

example.ex: He took up office out of a sense of duty...
example.tran: 他就任公职是出于一种责任感。

example.ex: Some people have left out of embarrassment at what's happened to them.
example.tran: 一些人已经由于为发生在自己身上的事感到难堪而离开了。

entry.tran: （通常指在对方不情愿的情况下）从（某人）身上（获得信息或工作成果）
entry.def: If you get something such as information or work out of someone, you manage to make them give it to you, usually when they are unwilling to give it.

example.ex: 'Where is she being held prisoner?' I asked. 'Did you get it out of him?'...
example.tran: “她被囚禁在什么地方？”我问道，“你从他口里套出来没有？”

example.ex: We knew we could get better work out of them.
example.tran: 我们知道他们可以做得更漂亮。

entry.def: If you get pleasure or an advantage out of something, you get it as a result of being involved with that thing or making use of it.

example.ex: We all had a lot of fun out of him...
example.tran: 他给我们带来很多快乐。

example.ex: To get the most out of your money, you have to invest.
example.tran: 要想把钱的收益最大化，就必须投资。

entry.def: If you are out of something, you no longer have any of it.

example.ex: I can't find the sugar — and we're out of milk.
example.tran: 我找不到糖——而且我们也没牛奶了。

entry.def: If something is made out of a particular material, it consists of that material because it has been formed or constructed from it.

example.ex: Would you advise people to make a building out of wood or stone?
example.tran: 你会建议人们用木材还是石头建房子呢？

entry.def: You use out of to indicate what proportion of a group of things something is true of. For example, if something is true of one out of five things, it is true of one fifth of all things of that kind.

example.ex: Two out of five thought the business would be sold privately on their retirement or death...
example.tran: 五个人之中有两个认为公司会在他们退休或去世时被私下卖掉。

example.ex: In 99 cases out of a hundred this will be done more effectively by the army.
example.tran: 这件事让军队来做十之八九会更有效。

means.word_mean: 1. (baseball) a failure by a batter or runner to reach a base safely in baseball;
1. to state openly and publicly one's homosexuality;
3. be made known; be disclosed or revealed;
1. not allowed to continue to bat or run;

sentences.sentence: "he was tagged out at second on a close play"

means.word_mean: 2. of a fire; being out or having grown cold;

sentences.sentence: "threw his extinct cigarette into the stream"

means.word_mean: 3. not worth considering as a possibility;

sentences.sentence: "a picnic is out because of the weather"

means.word_mean: 4. out of power; especially having been unsuccessful in an election;

sentences.sentence: "in our house dancing and playing cards were out"

means.word_mean: 6. directed outward or serving to direct something outward;

sentences.sentence: "the out surface of a ship's hull"

means.word_mean: 10. knocked unconscious by a heavy blow

sentences.sentence: "he gave out money to the poor"

list.explanation: 情绪恢复正常的，理智的

example.en: A: I was really emotionally fucked up. B: Are you evened out now?
example.zh: 甲:我心里乱透了。乙:现在好了吗？

slang.tokens: make little ones out of big ones

list.explanation: [黑社会用语]在狱中服刑(原指在狱中服劳役，将大石块砸成小石块)

example.en: He got made little ones out of big ones for two years.
example.zh: 他坐了两年牢。

list.explanation: (吸海洛因后毒性发作)感到心绪异常欣快的

example.en: Walter's nodded out after his fix.
example.zh: 沃尔特打了一针毒品后，感到飘飘欲仙。

list.explanation: 短少，没有

example.en: I'm fresh out of coffee so you'll have to have tea.
example.zh: 我没有咖啡了，所以只好委屈你喝茶。

list.explanation: 大量，许许多多

example.en: We have old magazines out the gazoo here. Can't we throw some of them away?
example.zh: 我们这里有好多旧杂志。难道我们不能把它们扔掉几本吗？

list.explanation: 到处，每个地方

example.en: Go away. I have problems our the gazoo. I don't need any more of them from you.
example.zh: 你们走吧。我的问题到处都是。我不想你们再来添乱。

list.explanation: 严厉责骂某人，折磨，惹怒某人

example.en: He really ranks me out. What a pest!
example.zh: 他可真把我惹火了。真是个害人精!

example.en: He will rank you out for what happened.
example.zh: 为了那事，他会跟你闹个没完。

list.explanation: 令人不快的、讨厌的人或事情

example.en: What a barf-out!I want my money back.
example.zh: 真是件令人不快的事!我要讨问我的钱!

example.en: That guy is a real barf-out.
example.zh: 那家伙真是个讨厌鬼。

list.explanation: Barf out![学生用语]真恶心!这是不能接受的!讨厌透顶!

example.en: Look at that wimp!Barf out!
example.zh: 瞧那个低三下四没骨气的人!真恶心!

list.explanation: [艺术界用语]异乎寻常的，奇特的，先锋派的，深奥神秘的

example.en: Susan did not like the paintings at the show because they were too way-out for her.
example.zh: 苏珊不喜欢展览会上所展出的画, 在她看来，那些画太标新立异了。

list.explanation: 极好的，很棒的

example.en: You got four tickets for the concert? Way out!
example.zh: 你拿到了四张音乐会的票子？太棒了!

list.explanation: (饮酒)醉了的，(吸毒) 受麻醉了的

example.en: That guy is way out—can't even walk.
example.zh: 那家伙喝醉了——甚至连走路也不行了。

example.en: She was so way-out ，she was almost unconscious.
example.zh: 她被毒品麻醉得几乎不省人事了。

list.explanation: 击倒、打昏(某人)，伤害 (某人)

example.en: Bob dukcd out the mugger with a jab to the check.
example.zh: 鲍勃朝那行凶抢劫者的脸颊猛击一拳,把他打昏。

example.en: Dirk Hamilon duked himself out.
example.zh: 德克汉密顿结果伤了自已。

list.explanation: 回避，逃避

example.en: I don't want to cop out of answering your question.
example.zh: 我并不想要对你的问题避而不答。

list.explanation: (黑社会用语)承汄有罪以求轻判，避重就轻地认罪

example.en: Frank copped out and got off with a night in the cooler.
example.zh: 弗兰克避重就轻地认了罪，只坐了一夜牢。

list.explanation: 畏缩不前，放弃

example.en: Why do you want cop out just when things are going great?
example.zh: 正当形势大大向前进展的时候，为什么你恰恰要退缩不前呀？

list.explanation: 从(某事物中)挣脱出来，摆脱(某事物)

example.en: Don't try to squirrel out of it. Go through with it.
example.zh: 这事你别想摆脱得了。把它进行到底吧。

list.explanation: (爵士乐界用语)无拘朿地进行演奏

example.en: She stretches out.，and everybody listens.
example.zh: 她泰然自若地演奏着，大家都静静地听着。

list.explanation: 假装伤病的职业乞丐

example.en: A throw-out who feigns sickness on the street is trying to gain sympathy from passers for begging money.
example.zh: 一个在街上假装有病的乞丐正在想方设法获取过路人的同情，向他们讨钱。

list.explanation: 入睡的，睡热的

example.en: Here, it is ten o'clock,and he is still sacked oul!
example.zh: 瞧，已经10点钟了，而他还在睡吶!

list.explanation: (在吸毒多年的瘾君子身上发生的)毒瘾逐渐消失现象或自愿戒毒现象

example.en: That guy has reached an age when drugs no longer have the desired effect. He got a burning out.
example.zh: 那个人已到了吸毒不再带来享受的年纪。他的毒瘾逐渐消退。

list.explanation: 申斥，训斥，谴责

example.en: President Truman on Tuesday dealt the new Czechoslovak Ambassador a first class bawling out.
example.zh: 杜鲁门总统星期二给了捷克斯洛伐克新任大使最严厉的谴责。

list.explanation: 非常生气的，十分烦恼的

example.en: Man, there is no reason to get so bent out of shape. I didn't mean any harm.
example.zh: 老兄,你没有理由要发这么大的火。我没有任何恶意。

example.en: I got bent out of shape because of maltreatment I received.
example.zh: 我因为受到了虐待而感到很气愤。

list.explanation: (吸毒)被麻醉的，喝醉的

example.en: I was so bent out of shape I thought I'd never recover.
example.zh: 兴时我喝得烂醉如泥，以为自己永远也醍不过来了。

list.explanation: 占上风，取胜

example.en: Who came out on top in the poll?
example.zh: 这次民意测验中淮占了上风？

list.explanation: 穿着得既正规又漂亮的

example.en: Wow，you look spiffed out! Where are you going?
example.zh: 哇!你的样子看上去既端正又漂亮!你上哪儿去？

list.explanation: 精神错乱的,发疯的

example.en: She has her cutting out paper dolls.
example.zh: 她已经神经错乱了。

slang.tokens: get ones nose out of joint

list.explanation: 小看、轻视(别人干的事)，生气，见怪

example.en: You get your nose out of joint too easily about stuff like that.
example.zh: 你太轻易地小看那样的事儿了。

example.en: Now, don't get your nose out of joint.She didn't mean it.
example.zh: 嗳，你别见怪。 她不是故意的。

list.explanation: (黑人用语)穿得很漂亮的

example.en: The children were fonked out heavy.
example.zh: 孩子们穿得很漂亮。

list.explanation: 睡去的，昏迷的

example.en: You look pretty Haked-out yourself.
example.zh: 你着上去快睡着了。

list.explanation: 筋疲力尽的，疲劳不堪的.

example.en: The enemy troops were flaked-out and demoralized.
example.zh: 敌军疲劳不堪，士气低落。

list.explanation: 钱(尤指第一批付款或投资)

example.en: A whole lot of what you call your up-front whip-out.
example.zh: 这就是你所谓的预付款的全部。

list.explanation: 最好的，突出的人或事物,比赛中取胜的选手

example.en: Bob is a real stand-out in our bowling league.
example.zh: 鲍勃是我们保龄球联谊会里一位不凡的人选。

example.en: This car is a real stand-out as a speed machine.
example.zh: 这部汽车是一辆最棒的高速汽车。

list.explanation: 不在某人管辖之内的

example.en: The matter's fortunately out of my league.
example.zh: 幸亏这件事不归我管。

list.explanation: 与某人不属同一类型的

example.en: He was so sophisticated，just someone way out of her league.
example.zh: 他是那么老于世故，跟她完全是两路人。

list.explanation: [青少年用语]令人讨厌 (的)、深恶痛极(的)、作呕(的)人、行为或事物

example.en: That horror movie was a real gross-out.
example.zh: 那部恐怖片真是一部叫人倒胃口的电影。

example.en: What a gross-out day has been!
example.zh: 这一天过得可真没劲!

example.en: He attempts the ultimate gross-out "self-expression" of the kind found in Greenwich Village.
example.zh: 他试图摆出那副臭架子格林威治村里的那种"自我表现"的神气。

list.explanation: 全速地，尽全力地，非常忙地

example.en: They're working flat out to finish on time.
example.zh: 他们止在加紧工作，想要准时完工。

example.en: We're flat out this week and can't fit in another single appointment.
example.zh: 这个星期我们忙得不得了，不能安排其他任何约会了。

list.explanation: 不能取胜的或成功的，淘汰的

example.en: The Hawks are out of it this season.
example.zh: 近来鹰派人失势了。

example.en: If our team loses two more games, we'll be out of it.
example.zh: 要是我们队再输两场，那我们就会被淘汰。

list.explanation: 不合潮流的，背时的

example.en: He's a nice guy, but he's out of it.
example.zh: 他人是个好人，可惜不合潮流。

example.en: Fred is out of it most of the time. He even looks dull.
example.zh: 弗雷德常常不合潮流，他甚至看上去都木讷迟钝。

list.explanation: (吸毒迷醉而)神志恍惚的，酒醉的

example.en: I had been so out of it, I hadn't heard her question.
example.zh: 那时候我神忐恍惚，根本没有听见她的问话。

list.explanation: 揣测某人的动机、举动，猜测、摸透某人的(心理)情况

example.en: The batter tried to psych out the pitcher, but it didn't work.
example.zh: 击球员竭力想捉摸出投球员的投球动向，可是没有用。

list.explanation: 使某人心情紧张、惊慌失措等

example.en: He won't psych me out as he did her.
example.zh: 他能唬住她，但吓唬不了我。

list.explanation: 试图探测出、估摸、调查发现 (某人的真相或底细)

example.en: I can't seem to suss Tom out. What a strange guy.
example.zh: 我好像没法捉摸出汤姆是什么样的人。真是个怪人。

list.explanation: 衣服，服装，(尤指平时一般小穿的)奇装异服

example.en: That rig-out does not suit her.
example.zh: 那种衣服不适合她。

example.en: a waiter's rig-out
example.zh: 一套服务员穿的服装

list.explanation: 昏厥，晕倒

example.en: He blacked out at the sight of his own blood.
example.zh: 他一看见 自己的血就晕倒了。

list.explanation: 失去对某事的记忆力

example.en: I totally blacked out that evening.
example.zh: 那天晚上的事我一点都不记得了。

list.explanation: 不(向某区)播送电视(尤指体育比赛节目)

example.en: The whole region was blacked out for the final game.
example.zh: 电视不向全区播放这场决赛的实况。

list.explanation: 引起神经紧张的，情绪不安的，提心吊胆的，心理脆弱的

example.en: I get strung out before tests and other traumatic things.
example.zh: 毎次作化验和其他外伤性医治前，我就感到神经紧张。

example.en: She got herself strung way out …just one more little push and she was a dead duck.
example.zh: 她心理上脆弱极了…再进一步就要彻底完蛋了。

list.explanation: 吸毒成瘾的，受毒品麻醉的，成性的

example.en: Harry's strung out for good，I guess.
example.zh: 我想，加里这举子是永远毒瘾缠身了。

example.en: That guy was strung out on crime.
example.zh: 那个家伙已犯罪成性了。

list.explanation: [黑人用语]着迷的，在恋爱中的

example.en: Sam is strung out over Mary.
example.zh: 山姆迷上了玛丽。

list.explanation: 非常害怕

example.en: Oh，what you said! I'm breaking out into assholes? No!
example.zh: 啊，你说什么!我心惊胆战？不!

list.explanation: 忍耐下去,持到底

example.en: It's rough as hell,but I'll stick it out.
example.zh: 日子难过得要命，不过我会坚持下去的。

example.en: The hundred stricken stuck it out to the end.
example.zh: 有上百名罢工者坚持罢工到底。

slang.tokens: Get the lead out！(=Shake the lead out!)

list.explanation: (表示要快速做事的命令语)

example.en: Get the lead out and start writing!
example.zh: 快点动手写吧!

example.en: Shake the lead out!I want it done today，not next week.
example.zh: 加紧干!我要它今天就完成，不要拖到下周。

slang.tokens: stick out like a sore thumb

list.explanation: 显得非常突出

example.en: Do you think I would stick out like a sure thumb at the party if I wore this coat?
example.zh: 如果我穿这件上装, 你看我在宴会上会抢眼吗？

list.explanation: 利用一切可以利用的东西，继续全力以赴

example.en: Then the mayor decided to pull out all the stops.
example.zh: 于是市长作出决定，继续全力以赴。

auth_sentence.content: Find out more about our use of this data.
auth_sentence.res_content: Find out more about our use of this data.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Find out more about our use of this data.

auth_sentence.content: Seek out that and the first two albums instead.
auth_sentence.res_content: Seek out that and the first two albums instead.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Seek out that and the first two albums instead.

auth_sentence.content: Check out the BBC Learning Scotland blog on exams.
auth_sentence.res_content: Check out the BBC Learning Scotland blog on exams.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Check out the BBC Learning Scotland blog on exams.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"出去.过时,外面"; 2. 表示"超过.过度"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 室外的, 户外的, 野外的
stems_affixes.word_buile: out出去.过时,外面+door门→adj.室外的, 户外的, 野外的
out出去.过时,外面+er→adj.外部的,外面的,外层的
out出去.过时,外面+going走→走出来→心胸宽→待人友善的
out出去.过时,外面+land地+ish……的→外地来的→奇异的
out出去.过时,外面+ward方向→向外的
out超过.过度+size范围→范围超出
out超过.过度+standing标准的→adj.突出的, 显著的
out出去.过时,外面→adv.出外;在外 v.公布
out出去.过时,外面+door户+s→n.户外 adv.在户外, 在野外
out出去.过时,外面+side旁边→在外边
out出去.过时,外面+ward方向→向外的
out出去.过时,外面+break中断→事情断裂→爆发
out出去.过时,外面+door户+s→n.户外 adv.在户外, 在野外
out出去.过时,外面+flow流→流出

stems_affixes.value_cn: 外出, 旅行, 散步
stems_affixes.word_buile: out出去.过时,外面+ing状态→n.外出, 旅行, 散步
out出去.过时,外面+let表名词→n.出口, 出路
out出去.过时,外面+line线条→划出线条→大纲

stems_affixes.value_cn: 景色, 风光, 观点
stems_affixes.word_buile: out出去.过时,外面+look看→n.景色, 风光, 观点

stems_affixes.value_cn: 产量, 输出, 输出量
stems_affixes.word_buile: out出去.过时,外面+put放,摆→放出,输出→产量
out出去.过时,外面+rage怒气→怒气外露→粗暴
out出去.过时,外面+set安置好→在外面放置好→开端
out出去.过时,外面+skirt裙子;引申为城市周边+s→郊区
out出去.过时,外面+work工作→户外工作;在工作上胜过
out超过.过度+law法律→超越法律之人
out出去.过时,外面→adv.出外;在外 v.公布
out出去.过时,外面+flow流→流出
out出去.过时,外面+work工作→户外工作;在工作上胜过
out超过.过度+bid出价→出价超出
out超过.过度+do做→做得超出别人
out超过.过度+live活→超过别人活着
out超过.过度+number数量→v.在数量上超过
out超过.过度+wear穿→穿出了[洞]
out超过.过度+wit智慧→机智超出别人

Sentence.sentence: To be sure, robotics are not the only job killers Out there, with outsourcing（外包）stealing far more jobs than automation.

means.word_mean: 离开某地, 不在里面

sentences.en: Let's go out for a walk.
Open the bag and put the money out.
sentences.cn: 打开提包, 把钱拿出来。

means.word_mean: 不在家, 不在工作地点; (书等)已借出

sentences.en: Let's have an evening out at the theatre.
sentences.cn: 让我们出去到剧院消磨一个晚上吧。

sentences.en: He stays out late at nights.
sentences.cn: 他晚上经常在外面逗留到很晚。

means.word_mean: 表示远离陆地、祖国、城镇等

sentences.en: They are all out at sea.
His son is out in America.

means.word_mean: 显露, 暴露, 问世

sentences.en: The apple blossom is out.
Their secret is out.
His new book is just out.
Long skirts went out last year.
sentences.cn: 长裙子去年就不流行了。

sentences.en: That dress is out.
Read out the names.
If you disagree you should speak out.
sentences.cn: 如果不同意, 你就该大声地说出来。

means.word_mean: 到尽头; 全部, 彻底

sentences.en: I'm tired out.
Supplies are running out.
He has worked out a mathematical problem.
She's been out for ten minutes.
The fire is out.
Please put your cigarette out.
Don’t out your head while riding in the bus.
sentences.cn: 坐公共汽车时别把头伸出窗外。

jushi.english: The Labor Party went out in 1980.
They are all out at sea.
He was knocked out in the second round of the fight.
jushi.chinese: 他在拳击赛的第二回合被击倒。
